provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In these Regulations-
     "Board" means the University Hospital Board of Management
         constituted under the Act;
     "Hospital" means the University Hospital established pursuant to
          the provisions of the Act;
     "Blue Cross patients" means the patients receiving medical treat-
          ment under the Blue Cross Scheme operated by the Federated
          Health Insurance Association Limited;
     "income" means-
             (a) in relation to an unmarried patient, the net income
                  of such patient;
             (b) in relation to a married patient, the joint net income
                  of the patient and the husband or wife of such
                 patient, as the case may be;
             (c) in relation to a child patient, the joint net income
                 of the parents or guardians of such child patient:
                   Provided that in the computation of income a
                 deduction of $1.00 per week each shall be made in
                 respect of a wife and every dependent.
              [The inclusion of chis page is authorized by L.N. 4119761
                THE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL (BLUE CROSS PATIENTS FEES)
                                REGULATIONS, 1963

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. No person shall post or display any advertisement, circular or placard or
paint any word or picture on, or distribute any matter in, any part ofthe Hospital
premises without the permission of the Board.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8.-(1) No person, other than an employee who works in a restricted area or
a security officer on duty at the Hospital, may enter or remain in a restricted area
unless authorized by the Board.
        ( 2 ) A person, not being an employee or a person authorized under
paragraph ( I ) , shall, while in a restricted area on the request of a security officer
on duty at the Hospital-
      (a)    state his name and address;
      (b)    produce a valid identification; and
       (c)   produce a valid document, if any, attesting to the purpose of his
             presence in and the authority upon which he entered the area.
                                                                   a
          (3) A person who fails to comply with request under paragraph ( 2 )
may be ordered by the security officer toleave the restricted area; and where he
fails to leave he may be liable to be physically removed therefrom by the security
officer or such other person acting in aid of the security officer with such force
as may be reasonably necessary in the circumstances.
                   [The inclusion of' this page is nuthorized by   L.N. 102/2001]
               T H E UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL (SECURITY) BY-LA WS, 1999
          (4) No person shall drive into or park, or use or operate amotor vehicle
in restricted area without the approval of the Board.
          (5) A person who is authorized under paragraph (I) to be in a restricted
area shall, while in that area, follow any instructions given by the security officer
on duty.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10.--(I) No person shall operate a motor vehicle for hire or rental on the
 Hospital premises except with the permission of the Board and in accordance
 with such terms or conditions as the Board may impose.
             (2) Where a motor vehicle is operated for hire it shall, when not in
 operation, be parked in the area designated for such vehicles or at such other
place as a security officer may direct.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12.--(I) The Chief Security Officer shall, after consultation with the Hospital
 Administrator, cause to be placed, erected or displayed on the Hospital premises,
 such signs as are considered necessary for the proper direction, control and
 regulation of vehicular traffic thereon.
           (2) Any person operating a motor vehicle on the Hospital premises
 shall comply with the traffic signs thereon.
           (3) Pedestrians on the Hospital premises who are within pedestrian
 lane markings have the right of way over vehicular traffic.
           (4) No person shall load or unload any vehicle on the Hospital premises
 except at such places as may be designated for that purpose.
            (5) No person shall, while under the influence of alcohol, an intoxicating
 substance or a narcotic drug, operate or be in control of any motor vehicle or
 motorized equipment on the Hospital premises.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13.-(1) No person, other than a person seeking medical attention or who is
 being medically evaluated or is a patient in the Hospital, shall enter onto or
 remain on the Hospital premises while he is under the influence of alcohol, an
  intoxicating substance or narcotic drug.
            (2) No person shall commit any disorderly, obscene or indecent act or
  cause any nuisance or disturbance on the Hospital premises.
                    [The tnclus~on of this page 1s authorxed by L N 102/20011
              THE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL (SECURITY) B Y-LA WS, I999
        (3) No person shall, without reasonable cause, have in his possession
any narcotic drug while he is on the Hospital premises.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-(1)   No person shall engage in or organize any form of gambling on
the Hospital premises.
        (2) No person shall operate, cause to be operated or be involved in the
operation of any gambling device on the Hospital premises.

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. No person shall-
      (a) deposit or dispose of any litter, garbage, refuse, cigarette, cigar,
          matches or other material or article on the Hospital premises, except
          in a receptacle provided for that purpose;
      (b) use any sanitary convenience on the Hospital premises otherwise
          than in a clean, tidy and sanitary manner.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. No person shall interfere with, tamper with or damage any part of the
Hospital premises or any equipment, machinery, motor vehicle or appliance
which is located thereon.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18.-41) Subject to paragraph (2), a security officer, a member ofthe Jamaica
Constabulary Force or the Jamaica Defence Force, while on duty, may have on
the Hospital premises a firearm, ammunition, explosives or inflammable
material.
         (2) A person, other than aperson mentioned in paragraph (I), who has
in his possession a firearm or ammunition shall declare that fact to the security
officer who is stationed on duty at the Hospital entrance.
         (3) A security officer stationed on duty at the Hospital entrance who
has a reasonable suspicion that a person is entering the Hospital premises with
a firearm may require that person to immediately leave the premises.
